revised_title: Microscopic Observations of the Tongue and Taste
tldr: In this letter to the Royal Society, Anthony van Leeuwenhoek describes his microscopical observations of the tongue's structure and taste sensation. He discovered numerous tiny particles on the tongue's surface and inside its pores, which he believed were responsible for the sensation of taste. Van Leeuwenhoek also observed the tongue's structure in different animals, such as oxen and hogs, and found similar particles in their tongues as well.
